text: [Music]
Pinterest is the world's first visual
discovery engine our mission is to help
users discover and do things they love
today on our platform we have over 250
million monthly active users and we are
serving over 10 billion recommendations
every single day the scale of
infrastructure at Pinterest is pretty
enormous we have tens of thousands of
servers we have 300 bytes of data and we
have thousands of jobs and workflows
that all power the Pinterest experience
Pinterest has been on the cloud since
day one and it became clear that as the
company grew it is important for us to
reduce the overhead of managing virtual
machines thus we invested on kubernetes
as the computer infrastructure so we can
enable engineers to move fast and remove
that overhead of managing machines by
themselves we are able to take ideas
from ideation to production in a matter
of minutes whereas earlier it would take
us hours or days we spent over six weeks
evaluating multiple different
technologies in eligibilities Apache may
service docker swarm and even just
virtual machines the process involved
from all the way evaluating how
networking works to scheduling to
operations and also community support we
found that Cuba natives definitely aged
each one of those areas for us to make a
clear decision to move forward with
kubernetes our motivation of joining CN
CF was largely because of the community
that it gives us access to we are strong
believers in open source software and
what I engage and leverage the community
to scale the systems that we are using
machine learning is a critical use case
for Pinterest it's what powers our
visual discovery engine it was extremely
important for us to provide engineers a
quick and an easy way to build their
models iterate on their models scale and
deploy and end up serving to the end
customers humanities provide a clean
abstraction for us to build and iterate
on this use case as infrastructure
operators we rarely tend to focus
the user experience humanities
definitely provides a clean abstraction
for us to build a great platform without
exposing any of those intricate
operational details
[Music]
